verses.roman:
'ātmā'-śabde brahma, deha, mana, yatna, dhṛti
buddhi, svabhāva,--ei sāta artha-prāpti

synonyms: ātmā-śabde—by the word ātmā; brahma—the Absolute Truth; deha—the body; mana—the mind; yatna—endeavor; dhṛti—firmness; buddhi—intelligence; sva-bhāva—nature; ei sāta—these seven; artha-prāpti—obtainment of meanings.
translation: "The seven different meanings of the word ātmā are the Absolute Truth, the body, the mind, endeavor, firmness, intelligence and nature.
